p: Compound 1 was found to be the most effective compound (MIC: 1250 μg / mL) among the compounds whose antileishmanial activities were evaluated against Leishmania infantum promastigotes. In addition, compounds 3, 7 and 9 were found to have antileishmanial activity at different concentrations (MIC: 5000–10,000 μg/mL).
